docs.snippet: I see you are puzzled to understand the proposition of the rebel Government to buy one-half of the cotton crop. Let me tell you what Mr. Ex-Secretary COBB expects to make by his scheme, and how he expects to make it successful.

headline.main: THE GREAT INSURRECTION.; Highly Important News from Washington. Active Movements Among the Federal Troops. Thirteen Thousand Arrived Within a Week. An Attack from the Rebel Forces Probable. Their Position Ascertained by a Balloon Reconnoissance. Harper's Ferry Again in Possession of the Government. Position of General Patterson's Command. INTERESTING FROM FORTRESS MONROE. The Rebel Batteries at Sewell's Point Moved. A VESSEL CHASED BY A PRIVATEER. IMPORTANT EXPEDITION TO TEXAS. A BALLOON RECONNOISSANCE. IS RESTIONS OF THE RACHOLS. MANUFACTURING ARMS. STATIONERY. PICKING OFF THE PICKETS A MOVEMENT.

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT FORTRESS MONROE.; RETURN OF THE RECONNOITERING EXPEDITION.

docs.lead_paragraph: The regiment which yesterday made a reconnoissance towards Great Bethel, returned late in the evening, having gone to the neighborhood of Little Bethel. They brought back no intelligence of importance. In is understood, however, that the Confederates are concentrating a large force at Yorktown.

docs.snippet: BOARD OF EDUCATION THE NORMAL SCHOOL. A special meeting of the Board of Education was held, on Thursday, for the purpose of considering the propriety of abolishing the Normal School. The sum of $2,500 has always been appropriated annually for the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOARD OF EDUCATION THE NORMAL SCHOOL. A special meeting of the Board of Education was held, on Thursday, for the purpose of considering the propriety of abolishing the Normal School. The sum of $2,500 has always been appropriated annually for the support of this school; but a great many of the members of the Board are now in favor of abolishing it altogether. The matter was referred to a Committee of five for report.

docs.snippet: The schooner John N. Genin, Capt. PHILLIPS, employed as a Government transport, arrived at this port yesterday, bringing news from Fort Pickens to the 29th of May, Fort Jefferson, Tortugas, to June 9, and Key West to the 10th.

headline.main: FROM FORT PICKENS AND KEY WEST

docs.lead_paragraph: The schooner John N. Genin, Capt. PHILLIPS, employed as a Government transport, arrived at this port yesterday, bringing news from Fort Pickens to the 29th of May, Fort Jefferson, Tortugas, to June 9, and Key West to the 10th.
